intro: Nanorrhinum judaicum, commonly known as the Judean nanorrhinum, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It produces bright yellow or orange flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its unique appearance and ecological adaptations, it is often cultivated in xeriscapes and rock gardens.
